website_summaries.verdict: The most comfortable option if you want a well-made model and don't mind spending a higher price for a single chair.
pros: Made of bungee suspension construction that provides flexible support for up to 300 pounds
Has a padded backrest and adjustable armrests

customer_reviews.title: Frame bent - Manufacturer will not honor warranty because product was purchased from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very big and is comfortable but it only held up for a few weeks before the frame bent when I got up,out of the chair. I bought this chair because it had a 350lbs weight limit and I thought it would be built better than the cheaper ones. So far the chairs I bought for half of the cost of this chair have held up much better. Update - I contacted the product manufacture Westfield Outdoors and was told that Amazon and Koftech are not authorized dealers so my warranty is void.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Stires

customer_reviews.title: will not support 303 lbs 350 is out of the question
customer_reviews.text: Product listed as 350 lb capacity. I am well under 350 lbs and the chair collapsed while I was laying in it. Up to this point I loved it. It was comfortable and supported me in the right places but it does not meet its stated weight capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Landrum

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gown downhill on this brand
customer_reviews.text: Rivets that hold fabric rusted within a few weeks. The wood armrest clear finish faded writhing weeks also. We owned this brand for several years in the same location and rivets never rusted. The chair is comfy & functional but in my opinion the quality of the materials has obviously changed. See pictures below comparing the 5 week old chair with the same brand 3 year old chair with no rust. Also see the faded armrest. Hard to believe the rust free one is 3 years older. Not recommended if you plan on using these outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: LISA DEHAVEN

customer_reviews.title: Great chair for activating the third eye.
customer_reviews.text: We use this chair in the operation of our business that provides access to a neuro-stimulating hypnagogic light which stimulates the pineal gland (the 3rd eye). [...] We provide the experience to clients reclining in a zero gravity chair and have been through a few different brands and types and have even had a couple others get bent with usage. This Timber Ridge XL is much sturdier, roomier, more attractive, and more comfortable than any we've purchased before. We initially hesitated purchasing one because it was a little more expensive, but once we started using it, we recommended it to others doing similar work and we will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Gotta Say

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an occasional user. This chair is in my studio and I'm in it daily. I had the regular timber ridge for 5 or 6 years but after continuous use one of the bolts gave way so I order the XL and glad I did. It's not that much bigger but much better made. The locking mechanism is much easier to operate and the extra width adds to the comfort. Bottom line is it's worth the higher price. One possible negative is the XL does not have the built in side table. Just a clip on cup holder. I never used it so don't care personally. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ruggedrobb

customer_reviews.title: WARNING:  Contains one or more chemicals know to cause cancer and/or birth defects.
customer_reviews.text: Nowhere in the ad does it say this, but the warning tag says it all. I have emphysema, COPD and asthma, I certainly would not have purchased this had I known it contained these hazardous items.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelZ

customer_reviews.title: Disappearing finish
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very comfortable and good looking. I would have given it a 5 star rating except for the wooden arms. The chair has been out on my deck for less than a month and after 2 weeks I noticed the arms where beginning to crack and the finish has disappeared, not from wear it but from the elements, the chair has only been sat in a half dozen times. have reported this to the seller and am awaiting their response. I have asked for new arms. .
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jack

customer_reviews.title: Bad.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed nice at first. Does not last. It rusts all over. The wood discolors, cracks, and warps. I would steer clear.
customer_reviews.author: BCW

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and well built, but needs a minor footrest tweak
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It’s comfortable, a little on the heavy side, but well constructed. The only reason I’m giving it 4-stars is because the footrest is uncomfortable barefooted or with socks on. To alleviate this, I recommend getting a $3 pipe insulation tube from the hardware store and putting that down there.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The round tube frame broke within two months, and I don 't weigh anywhere near 300 lb.s.
customer_reviews.author: motomech

customer_reviews.title: Large, comfortable.  Disappointing QC issue, but still functional for me.
customer_reviews.text: Initially the points of 2 screws sticking up slightly though right armrest, scratching arm and catching clothing. need better QC for that sort of thing. Could have been 5 stars but for that. I knocked the screw points flat with a light hammer, leaving a couple visible, but smooth mounds on the arm rest; good enough for me. Others are likely to care more. It's larger than most I've tried, fits me better, fairly comfortable. No other issues after frequent use for several months, but I do find myself wishing there was a foot-pad covering the bottom bar, as my feet extend past the end when reclined.
customer_reviews.author: B Snow

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many gravity chairs over the years. Some heavy duty, some not. This one is very uncomfortable and difficult to recline and stay reclined. The angles are wrong for being a comfortable gravity chair. It makes me feel like I am slouching and your lower legs at a steep angle. Wanted to return it to Amazon but they won't let me. They say this item can't be shipped back because "the item contains flammable liquids or gases and can't be returned to Amazon".. So my question is, how did they ship it to me but I can't ship it back?? Frustrating.....
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Great chair!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he loves it. It is well made as the canvas is heavy, the webbing it tight and strong and nice wood accents. I did find the cup hold a bit flimsy. My husband is 6'3" and I am 4'11" and we both find the chair comfortable, especially like the adjustable head pillow. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: allycat

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: A year ago I bought a somewhat similar chair for about half the price and this is definitely twice as good as that one was. This one is bigger, more comfortable and much sturdier. It was definitely worth the price. I wish I had bought this one originally. I saw one review saying it’s not a zero gravity chair. I don’t know how they can say that. It reclines back to a pretty much horizontal position, just not completely flat. It is very relaxing and I did feel like I was almost floating. The reclining action is smoother and easier than my previous chair, too. I’m a tall, curvy gal and do not feel squished on this chair.
customer_reviews.author: TV Momma

customer_reviews.title: Wooden arm rests DEFECTIVE Grommets DEFECTIVE  TO BAD NICE CHAIR to look at
customer_reviews.text: I purchase 4 FOUR Zero Gravity Lawn Chairs and left them outside on my patio After a couple of rain days the chairs became water logged on the wooden arm rests and black mildew type stain occurred Also the Brass type grommets used to connect thereat material to the metal frame rusted when in contact to the person sitting rust and marks from the armrest transferred to the skin and clothes. Square Trade insurance would not cover this because water was involved Also metal tubing filled w/water and when moved rusted water poured out
customer_reviews.author: KIMBERLY A. KILFOYLE

customer_reviews.title: Handles have turned black. I don't recommend buying these.
customer_reviews.text: I loved these chairs when I got them. They are very comfortable. Only problem is within a month the handles on the chair have completely molded and turned black. I bought two of these and they both have done the same thing. For as much as I paid for these it should have never done that. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Wooden arms already splitting and veneer has rubbed off
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two chairs in April. They shipped April 10th, but we did not take them out of the boxes until early May. We bought the wood arm option because the metal can get very hot. Like advertised, the chair is very comfy and easy to adjust. However, the wood arms are already deteriorating after a month outside. I am going to call the company to see if we can get this issue fixed, but I thought it was important for a buyer to know that this is possible since it happened with both chairs.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Corn

customer_reviews.title: Best Lounge Chair Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This chair is excellent!! I love its sturdiness and how easy it is to get a perfect, comfortable position. I also really appreciate that the headrest is removable because I did not want to use that. Due to ramifications from a concussion, I have needed to sleep in a recliner each night, and was concerned about what I would be able to do when traveling because most hotel rooms do not have recliners. I researched lounge-chair options on Amazon and read reviews for this chair, which has even exceeded my expectations! Thanks so much to the manufacturer, other reviewers, and Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Susan R. Withers

customer_reviews.title: Maybe maybe maybe
customer_reviews.text: I’ve spent a lot of hours in this chair. It’s been great! My only issue is that the wooden armrests are a little hard on my sweet baby elbows. I’m 6’3” and it’s just the tiniest bit short but no biggie, lots of comfy naps. Now that we have all that out of the way, it broke on me yesterday (240#). The bungee snapped. It’s been less than a year so the warranty will get it, right? Nope. Not if you buy from amazon rather than directly from the business. I recommend this chair only if you’re light and won’t sit on it often.
customer_reviews.author: Prepaid Gift Card

customer_reviews.title: The seat is nice but I have used it for one month and ...
customer_reviews.text: The seat is nice but I have used it for one month and the arms of the chair are peeling. Not worth the $$
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but Not Long Enough for Me
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and is very comfortable. Unfortunately, although it's stated as being oversized XL, my feet hang over the end about 4 or 5 inches if I fully stretch out on the chair. I'm 6'3".
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We use this chair for our PEMF machine mat because it's wider than the standard size model. It's very comfortable and sturdy. You may have a little trouble sitting back up though. I usually have to swing my legs to get up out of it. It is pretty heavy though, so you may not want to cart it around.
customer_reviews.author: Brandeline

customer_reviews.title: Completely collapsed!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product was the greatest. I never let it be outside except during camping trips. Sadly, just after a year, the entire frame bent rendering it useless. The company just told me it was too bad as it only had a one year warranty. Very disappointed! I will be looking for a better company from which to buy a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Deirdre Jensen-Soliz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Star Gazing
customer_reviews.text: We needed some comfortable, well made zero gravity chairs and that is exactly what we got with these made by Timber Ridge. No cheap plastic; just high quality. They are a little tough to fold up but once you get the hang of it, no big deal. It's been really hot here the last few nights so tonight we're going to put them on our deck and have a "sleep out". That's how comfortable they are!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost fabulous
customer_reviews.text: I love almost everything about this chair: * Comfortable padding; * Adjustable head/lumbar support; * Big enough for big people; * Sturdy and secure; * Reclines and locks into multiple positions. There's just one thing that made me ding it a star: The dinky plastic levers that lock the chair into place. They're so flimsy they almost flap around and I'm certain that with not too much use they will fail, and then the chair will be of little use to me. I can't understand why someone would make a quality zero gravity chair like this and saddle it with such cheapskate levers. I hope they update the design some day with sturdy metal levers.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Vines

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Extra Large Folding Chair
customer_reviews.text: The Timber Ridge Zero Gravity Locking Patio Lounger is extra large and seems to be very strong. There is a learning curve to operate the repositioning features. I wish that the back of the chair would recline more independently of the leg rest but I am learning to deal with this. Overall, this chair is attractive (I got the earth tone) and built to last. With the addition of some cushions it is quite comfortable. The locking mechanism works great once you learn how to operate it. I especially love the attachable cup holder that came with the chair.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline1

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and well constructed.....but it is not a chair you can leave outside. It collects water and does not dry for days resulting in a soaked backside. The arms looked worn after a week and, now, after 1 month, the arms are spotted with dark moldy looking spots and no varnish is left. Would I buy again? No.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry J. Block

customer_reviews.title: much better than most of its competition
customer_reviews.text: I waited to post a review because I have had a few of these types of chairs from other vendors. They have all broken and I top out at 225lb. I use this chair daily as I have back issues. It's well made, much better than most of its competition; but costs more. The fabric stretches w/time and changes the comfort level but not horribly so far. Otherwise, the steel is sturdier than others I have had the armrests wood topped are nice. An excellent product and not disappointed I spent the extra money.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Hesnan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I Received what appears to a Previously used chair as it was scuffed up and when I sat in it one side came apart great ordered it on prime so I could have it for a trip not enough time to return It had to fix it myself as I needed it for my trip when you pay for something new it should be in new condition not used and broken ☹️
customer_reviews.author: john f

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and very comfortable - wish they were a big longer.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, sturdy high quality chair. It’s good and wide. Wish it was 2” longer (I’m 6’4” and my heels hit the bar). However, every unit I checked out is this length. They seem to be built more to handle heavier people than taller people, but it’s definitely longer than the normal chair. Later, I was able to find units at BJs for a third of the price. Those are also good and big, but not quite as nice (upholstery, arm rests, etc). I’d recommend these. I just wish they were longer.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E Carson

customer_reviews.title: Overall disappointed...chair looks like its a few years old after only a month outdoors!
customer_reviews.text: Although comfortable, the chair does not stand up well to the elements. After about a month outside the finish on the wood arm rests was gone and the exposed wood looks significantly aged. All-in-all, I'm quite certain that you can likely find a comparable product at a lower price...just look!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Rusts & fades within a few months of use.
customer_reviews.text: Started off great. Very pleased with the colors, ease of use, mobility etc. Everything was as expected for the price point. Then after a few months of being outside (under a patio mind you -not even in direct sun), intense fading, rusting of parts, and grossly terrible feeling arm rests. Within just a few months. Way too expensive. One of the worst products I've ever purchased. And now I'm stick with 6 of them. FYI: my household purchases, conservatively, 40k worth of Amazon products annually, and this is one of the worst products we've encountered.
customer_reviews.author: Will Lundgren

customer_reviews.title: Float away pain
customer_reviews.text: Zero-gravity chairs were developed by NASA to mimic the weightlessness astronauts would experience in space. A true Zero Gravity Chair allows the spine to relax and reduces stress on your back. Friends use zero gravity chairs for camping and after a house fire I gave my previous zero gravity chair to the homeowner who had back problems and I know I will never see it again. Few items this inexpensive provide consistent comfort. So glad we purchased this heavy-duty, padded version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Chair is very nice and comfortable but the wooden arms deteriorated after they got wet the first time it was rained on. This is an outdoor chair. The finish on the arms should hold up better. This was one rainstorm.
customer_reviews.author: Love My 55

customer_reviews.title: If you buy one, buy two!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chair as a 'Lightning Deal'. It is, by far, the best lounge chair that I've ever purchased. I have terrible back pain due to an injury several years ago. Simply sitting in a deceptively comfortable summer lounge chair for too long, can often leave me laid up for days. This chair is comfortable while adding lumbar support. I'm not concerned that enjoying one afternoon in the sun will force me inside for the rest of the week. I bought one at regular price (very reasonably priced!) for my husband because he loved it so much. But, I wouldn't share mine!
customer_reviews.author: Doreen DeLuca

customer_reviews.title: Great chair
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable zero-gravity chair, and much bigger than the average/normal zero-gravity - very well built, sturdy, and ultra-comfy, it's almost like an automatic nap once you get settled in. Only con is that it is quite heavy, not exactly the kind of chair you want to lug over the dunes and down to the beach - luckily my wife and I use the drive-on surf fishing beaches here in Delaware, so that's not an issue - but it's not a deal breaker, this is a great chair!
customer_reviews.author: Steve G.

customer_reviews.title: No more lower back pain
customer_reviews.text: OMG! purchased this zero gravity lounger chair to sit on my porch and view the beautiful Colorado Mountains in comfort. This chair is so sturdy, solid and comfortable without the back pain of inexpensive camp chairs I have it in my family room. Zero gravity furniture is super expensive $2000 to $4000 for one lounger chair. Get the XL oversized padded version of this chair and you’ll always sit and lounge in comfort. For me the absence of lower back pain was the number 1 priority. It is weighty if you are going to take it camping. It’s not a chair you pick up and throw in the back of your SUV.
customer_reviews.author: jcrider319

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to fold, easy to tip
customer_reviews.text: For price; this is a solid chair & decent design for camping trips. Difficult to get in & out of chair if you have low back issues; which was reason I purchased this style. Anti-gravity does take pressure off spine and tilt is useful if you deal with cardiac issues (postural intolerance) Somewhat difficult to recline and will fall over backwards if not locked in place. Wish the drink holder was able to attach on either side and is somewhat clumsy (make sure it's firmly attached or you'll lose your beverage! :) Company is terrific; as is their customer support.
customer_reviews.author: NatalieBarney

customer_reviews.title: Fades quickly outdoors in indirect sunlight
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. It’s a comfortable chair. I’m 6 ft tall and the headrest is a bit low, only slightly, but moving it higher, it goes off the top of the seat back. The finish on the wooden arm rests was thin and with maybe a light rain and morning dew in the Rockies, which is generally a low humidity dry climate, it cracked and the wood swelled within a few weeks outside. It was kept on a deck on the North side of the house (in the shade) and the Fabric faded noticably in just a couple weeks. The fabric is not at all fade resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Well made, comfortable and oversized. Supports 350 lbs
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these chairs for a gift for friends who recently bought a camper. I did a lot of research & read a lot of reviews to find a quality chair that would be oversized & could support a higher weight. This chair offers both. Not only that, it is extremely comfortable as well. It has a nice headrest and wide armrests.. It also has a locking mechanism to set the position you prefer, and a beverage holder which comes in handy! I would recommend these chairs & will most likely be purchasing two more for my spouse & me!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Dont sit too long gets hot.
customer_reviews.text: I am deployed to Afghanistan. I have limited space. So I sort of change the configuration of my room depending on what I'm doing. This chair is used to kind of make a living room space. I managed to mount my TV on the bunk bed with a monitor mount. I can swing it out from under the top bunk and sit in front of it in this chair. I watch movies or play video games in it. My butt and back get sweaty if I sit for a while. The chair is sort of short for me (6ft tall) the bar is on my Achilles unless I put my feet on it. Its fairly comfortable other than that.
customer_reviews.author: Islandboy

customer_reviews.title: Can't talk, resting comfortably. 😉
customer_reviews.text: We loved that there was no assembly required. So far we're impress with the comfort and quality. The arms are wooden so there's some concern on the durability and care that might be needed as they're outdoor chairs. We also wished there was a position where you could sit more upright but have your legs elevated...like a recliner. We do love the chairs so far, though.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Haas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but no very comfy
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice sturdy chair. It folds easily and stores easily enough however, it's not very comfy. I removed the pillow because it just didn't feel like it was in the right spot and it was hard. I have another chair by a different brand at a summer home, which is why I ordered two for my house. It just wasn't the same. If you lay on this one too long, you sweat a lot, the material isn't comfortable or breathable. It's a good chair, sturdy and solid, I may be a bit biased because I'm comparing it to my favorite chair and its just not the same.
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Superior so far
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional initial quality compared to earlier version by another manufacturer (that we threw out). These seem well made of quality materials. Sturdy. Well padded. Good looking. Comfortable. Could do without the advertisement on the pillow. Will try to remember to update when we find out whether a) the support fills with water that rusts from within, b) whether the pillow elastic rapidly wears out and stretches, c) whether the fabric can take the heat and rain and d) whether the locks that keep the recliner in a desired position keep working.
customer_reviews.author: Grunion  H

customer_reviews.title: Made for big and tall.
customer_reviews.text: This chair is built for a much larger person. I am 5ft 4, and short legged. My arms are too short to easily reach the release trigger at the ends of the arms. My feet just barely reach the bar at the end of the legs. The cushion for the head is sadly way too hard. Will have to return, which is a bit of a bummer, since the blasted thing weighs a ton.
customer_reviews.author: sulu

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship
customer_reviews.text: Seams are separated after only 35 uses and never taken outside. Warranty does not cover. Spend your money on a less expensive chair or different manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Powell

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and comfortable but not wearing well
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice chairs, comfortable to sit in, a bit of a struggle to fold up, one bar hits the other, but ok. For outdoors however they get soaked and the wood arms fade and the cushions get soggy. Really excellent for a protected area like a patio or sunroom, just don't plan to keep them outdoors unless you cover them up when not in use
customer_reviews.author: Kenwoodrobb

customer_reviews.title: Great chair and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Just received the timber ridge gravity chair. Very comfortable and very sturdy. But I must comment on the exceptional customer service during this purchase. Through no fault of NewMart, I had a problem with the delivery time. They offered different options to resolve my problem. They were most accommodating and going above and beyond to resolve my issue.
customer_reviews.author: sjl

customer_reviews.title: Why I Chose Timber Ridge.
customer_reviews.text: This Timber Ridge lounger is not outside. It is in our glassed porch. This zero gravity Christmas present replaced a recliner. Now if I can get our three year old cat out of it I will really enjoy it. Why I wanted i? I have circulation and arthritis in my legs and this fabulous chair relieves pain and pressure. Reading the many reviews, I knew this was the answer for needed sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Paradise of a Chair
customer_reviews.text: This chair is very comfortable and easily reclines very far back for relaxation. It is the most sturdy camping chair I have ever owned. It also comes with a cup holder, that was a good size and locks to keep the chair in place, if you find the perfect incline. I highly recommend this chair, you won't regret it. The only possible drawback is that it is bulky for packing purposes, larger than most camping chairs. So if you have very limited packing space, you might select a different chair. All I know is, this was worth the space it took up in the car... it is the best!
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: love the chair that is not damaged
customer_reviews.text: we received a damaged chair....love the chair that is not damaged.... very comfortable. I would not leave in the sun. My sister in law has a pair and they become quite faded...but, very nice color when new. A big person may have trouble sitting up......otherwise GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: kate eaton

customer_reviews.title: Mold on arms
customer_reviews.text: I really loved the chair when it arrived. Hard to figure out how to fold and unfold but that’s ok because it was going on my balcony for the summer. It was awesome and sturdy and really well made. THEN the mold on the wood arms appeared. It’s gotten worse over the last few weeks. Can’t wipe it off. My beautiful new chair looks gross. I’m going to contact the manufacturer and see what can be done. That would suck if I had to take it outside and then inside everyday. Title says it’s an “outdoor” chair.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Rockwood

customer_reviews.title: just got this today ...
customer_reviews.text: fully assembled (except for the cup holder - you slide that into place, if you want to bother with it). it's very comfortable, fully reclines (which was a neccessity for me), lightly padded. i immediately felt back pain relief upon reclining! i plan to use this in lieu of an actual recliner (because of costs) & i will probably add some pillows, etc to make it a bit more padded. it'll only be me using it, so i hope it holds up for daily use! if it breaks soon - i'll be updating this pronto! LOL if there's no updates, then it means it's holding up & i'm probably reclined in it, relaxing.
customer_reviews.author: Cherie Volante

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but needs better QA
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these for the little seating area we have set up in our garage. We've even taken them camping. They're spacious and comfy. However, on both of the chairs we bought, the bolt holding the right armrest to the back of the chair came loose within a matter of weeks. One fell completely out. The other almost did, but the nut was located and we were able to get it fastened again. We're out of luck on the other one though. I think the nut went missing while we were camping. We'll have to jury rig it with after-market parts.
customer_reviews.author: Dyreka Klaus

customer_reviews.title: well made and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: just took these chairs for a test drive at the beach camping, they are very comfortable and appear to be well made. Make sure you release the two side locks before folding the chair up or changing sitting angles, I can see where you might break the locks if not careful. I'm a big buy the fit is great, I placed some foam pipe insulators on the foot bar and now everything is perfect. Nice chair to feel the ocean breezes through the air as a nap takes over!
customer_reviews.author: W. Jett

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and sturdy but buy a cover
customer_reviews.text: love the chair, very comfy and sturdy, fairly easy to fold and unfold and actually, not so heavy that you can't bring your comfort with you when visiting or whatever. The one thing that bugs me is that there is foam in between layers of fabric, and that foam retains moisture for DAYS, it takes a long time to dry out! Meaning I have had to break down and buy a cover. My husband has a similar chair, but is mesh. Just as comfortable, with annoying wet seat surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First class comfort
customer_reviews.text: The XL version of the Timber Ridge Outdoor Lounger is two inches wider in the seat and steel-framed instead of aluminum. Though slightly heavier to carry, it feels more sturdy and stable. The material is nicely padded along its full length, and the pillow is easily adjustable while remaining attached to the chair back. All in all, this is first-class comfort. We have 14 other chairs around our pool, but our two Timber Ridge Loungers are the first chairs our friends and guests head for.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Benner - Fearless Intelligence

customer_reviews.title: well made. worth the money
customer_reviews.text: it's of robust construction. I feel that it should last a long time. I am 6foot two inches, and it more than big enough for me. I bought it used and it was like new at arrival. however,both screws on the armrest, came undone and only found one of the two nuts, needed to put it back together. so now I have to check the screws before sitting down. but I would still buy another one again. I have bought zero gravity chairs before and they all fell apart.they were not near as well made as this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chair so far
customer_reviews.text: So far this chair is excellent... I am a 5'8", 176 pounds male age 71. For me this is the most comfortable zero gravity I have ever sat in... My 5'6" wife says it is comfortable but a little long for her overall. It is not light but so far is very solid. Some reviews say the padded material should not be left in the rain.. I agree and fold it up when not in use... For some reason the headrest is excellent...
customer_reviews.author: Ron B.

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and sturdy construction. You want be disappointed. Works smoothly to any position. Nice looking. I bought mine to sleep in while recovering from shoulder replacement that made lying in bed with a sling practically impossible.
customer_reviews.author: ThommoorFit

customer_reviews.title: wow, just buy this!
customer_reviews.text: I adore this chair! Bought two and wish I had done so earlier in the year. LOVE taking them out to the deck at sundown to relieve the stress of the day. Nice, smooth wooden handles. Unexpectedly love the cup tray, so glad I opted for a chair with this. It's right at your fingertips while you're horizontal. Being horizontal to the ground you feel like you're levitating. I keep them inside. Shopped hard and very happy with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy chair and is as described for sure. The seat is wide and the pillow comfortable. The chair is a bit heavy but manageable. I wish it had a strap to keep it closed on transport though. Having said that I must say we tried a number of these zero gravity chairs and had a terrible time getting them back and then to reach the lock, once that was done only to discover the lock didn't work at all. This chair has NONE of these issues!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfortable! You won’t regret!
customer_reviews.text: Good product! It is the ultimate resting spot for my family. The material is thick canvas, stents are made of metal and the wooden arms makes it feel great. The pillow is perfect for just lying back and relaxing. My favorite part of the chair aside from the comfort is the cup holder and it has another small compartment for a phone. The chair is super solid and easy to lie back and relax. I couldn't help fall asleep on it. I'm very happy with this purchase! I will buy one more, it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ziqi

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: Cannot rate pain as I have no problems. Have had chair approx a week. It is comfortable in low back area compared to the one I have from Bed & Bath. Locking mechanism is much better and the wood arm rest makes for added comfort. The price is higher, but if you have low back issues I would go with this one. I’m massage therapist plus RN and am big on positioning for health and comfort. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Not one

customer_reviews.title: Thoughtful gift for mom
customer_reviews.text: My mom loves her birthday gift! She keeps the chair on her covered patio out of the sun and rain, so it should last for a while. She said that the chair is “plenty wide” and warm (she often gets chilled on her back and shoulders sitting in outdoor furniture). It is a good height for a senior to sit in and get up from, and the locking mechanism for the recline is easy to figure out. Most importantly the dogs approve!
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable to read in
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the recliner for several weeks now. Though it is a little heavy and a bit difficult for me to fold (I am still working out the easiest way), it is SO comfortable and serves exactly the purpose for which I ordered it -- to read comfortably on the outside deck. It provides just the right amount of support and the adjustable tilt and extension mean that one can readjust from time to time for maximal comfort. The chair is very sturdy and good looking and the adjustable pillow is a welcome feature. Also love the attachable cup-holder/tray. This one's a winner
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: BUY THESE
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as described. Well made, XL size, and beyond comfortable! Worth the price. I spent way too much time reading reviews and cross comparing zero gravity chairs. I wish I would have just went with this one from the beginning. The extra padding is incredible- plus they’re easy to fold and carry!
customer_reviews.author: lauren

customer_reviews.title: No regrets! Worth the extra dollars.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third zero gravity chair I have owned. One off-brand I purchased overseas, one Caravan Sports Oversized, and then this Timber Ridge. It is hands down the best of the three, and I REALLY liked the Caravan Sports chair. It is durable, has a pleasing color scheme, and a built in cup holder. The extra padding all over that exists by design makes a nice difference. I struggled to justify the increased price over the other options, but as soon as it showed up I felt great about the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: given that it's made in china don't expect much from the directions although it is easy enough to operate
customer_reviews.text: the directions are under the chair and attached as one of those do not remove tags. given that it's made in china don't expect much from the directions although it is easy enough to operate. appears strong enough to get this 300 pounder comftorable
customer_reviews.author: Richard K.

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have spent a few hours at a time in the chair reading and not gotten uncomfortable. I am a big guy and the chair is very sturdy and the locking mechanism is easy and positive. Be aware that as nice as the padding is it doesn't dry right away after a rain, I just flip it on it's side so water doesn't pool on the seat area and it's fine. The coating on the metal seems very durable and I have no problem leaving it outside for the summer.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Carlton

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy Chair for 6'6" Man
customer_reviews.text: I looked at this chair and compared against all others and the thing that really drew me to this chair was the fact that it supported 350 lbs and had better support. My father-in-law is 6'6" and the chair fits him well even though his feet hang off about 2 inches. He's already fallen asleep in the chair and really enjoys it. This was a great Father's Day gift!
customer_reviews.author: David Sanders

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN TRAY BUT CHAIR VERY STURDY AND COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Love the chair! So comfortable and sturdy. Terribly disappointed that the try was broken so it is not useable. No one responded to my enquiry for a replacement, so that's disappointing overall in regard to lack of customer service.
customer_reviews.author: christine king

customer_reviews.title: Good for four months
customer_reviews.text: Bought in April. Loved the chair until the seams started ripping. Not even four months old and about useless now and looks terrible. Bought a new one today. Hadn’t realized how much the material faded! Look at the pictures for the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice, comfortable 72” long chair
customer_reviews.text: Like the chair a lot, just wish it was 2-3 inches longer. My achilles tendon rest on the bar and it gets uncomfortable after awhile. The drink holder on the right side is useful to put my iPhone on but the actual drink cup holder is way to far back and it would be nice to be able to install it on either side. None of this detracts from the quality and sturdiness of this otherwise very comfortable chair.
customer_reviews.author: T L S

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous.  Chair should be recalled
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous chair collapsed leaving me on the ground in a precarious position; thought I would need to call help as I am elderly. I do not weigh near the stated weight limit. The chair should be recalled before someone gets seriously hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Mark n hoagberg

customer_reviews.title: I love this chair!!
customer_reviews.text: Over the last 15 or so years, I've had three zero gravity type outdoor recliners - THIS IS BY FAR THE BEST! I store it in the garage in the Winter, but the rest of the time it's outdoors. Very, very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: TruthinAdvertising

customer_reviews.title: Easy to fold.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little sad when I received this product. Because it’s a lot of tapes on the package just looks like somebody who did return. And forget the package. I have to say it was easy to fold on my yard. And when you seat down it also feels comfortable. The things is which the chair have a little bit no stable. It’s a little bit shake. But when you seat on the chair, it’s not shake anymore. I put this chair in my yard. U can relax and enjoy the wind. I hope you guys who can get the exactly new one!
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: ONE STAR
customer_reviews.text: I've had these chairs less than a year and they are dry rotted, the fabric is tearing and splitting. I'm so upset. I purchased two and my daughter purchased two. A lot of money for us.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca G.

customer_reviews.title: Buckles and leaves you on the ground - JUNK
customer_reviews.text: This thing BUSTED/BUCKLED after one sitting. Guess I should have taken it out and used it before the return window closed. Didn’t know that you couldn’t return DEFECTED PRODUCT just because you ordered it early for a birthday gift and opened beyond return date. Don’t buy this junk.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great for people in pain.
customer_reviews.text: Got this chair for my husband for Father’s Day. He works hard and long hours and his body is sore and tired when he gets home. I’ve been looking for a chair that will he can sit it to alleviate pain and take pressure off of his body. This chair really helps him a lot. Folds up pretty easily once you realize the angle of it. It is a little tricky to get in and of it until you get the hang of it- that is the only negative thing about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for camping and fishing
customer_reviews.text: Compare with the one I bought from BBB, this one is definitely heavy duty and weather proof for outdoor activities. It is perfect for camping and fishing. I bought it to pair with the fishing chair I bought from the same seller a few month ago. I found this brand is much better than most of same products I saw in Dick’s. And price is lower for same quality. Next I probably gonna buy the camping bed to make the whole set!
customer_reviews.author: Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough to Sleep In
customer_reviews.text: I’m over 6’ tall. I have plenty of room from head to toes. Very comfortable...so much I find myself falling asleep in when I recline back. I take it outside and when I go camping. Wish it had some padding where my feet rest at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Prenthar

customer_reviews.title: Meets all expectations
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the large size because of my weight. I needed something for my bedroom that could fold up when not needed and this chair does that. My friends head for that chair and settle in for a chat or a nap and it is large enough for a blanket and pillow for sleeping. The construction is amazing with great attention to detail. Love the cup holder too.
customer_reviews.author: Sharyn Hay

customer_reviews.title: Updated 2020: Durabilty?
customer_reviews.text: Update: It is really comfortable. Unfortunately the seat fabric has worn in the sun over the past couple of years and ripped at a seam. The heat and sun here inSoCal are tough on outdoor furniture and I don't expect things to last forever. However there's no replacement parts (fabric sling and the arms) available from the manufacturer to repair the chair. The frame is still perfect. Disappointing for a quality item. Really comfortable chair for a tall guy - 6'2" - 210lbs. Has been outside in the sun for the last few months and all is well with it so far
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Love this chair!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this chair. I’m a bigger person (5’8” and 280 lbs) and this chair is super comfortable and sturdy. The only downside I would say is that it’s not very breathable. I almost always have a sweat mark on my back after using.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine Chandler

customer_reviews.title: my problem bad
customer_reviews.text: Hard for me to get out of it, my problem bad knees
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great chair with one minor recommendation.
customer_reviews.text: Great chair...I can office it 4/5 stars because the bar is uncomfortable for your legs/feet. If you buy an XL chair, you’re more than likely a big person, the bottom bar hits right on my ankles. This isn’t any different than any other gravity chair, but if your going to spend this kind of money for “The Best”, just add a high density foam cushion wrapped in thick nylon/plastic. Great sturdy, easy to use, and comfortable chair.
customer_reviews.author: RSweeten

customer_reviews.title: Poor QC results in self repair of chair
customer_reviews.text: Chair arrived with one hinge not assembled. Found missing bolt in box, however bushing installed on opposite hinge was missing. Rather then hassle with return, I improvised a bushing and fixed it myself. Obviously poor quality control from manufacturer. Otherwise fixed chair as functional as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and awkward to move around, but comfortable
customer_reviews.text: It’s very bulky, not at all easy to carry, no good way to carry it or handle on it anywhere, very heavy, it’s difficult to open and close.....but with all that said, it’s worth the trouble and pretty comfortable once you get it situated. If you’re just going to leave it outdoors and not moving it around much, you’ll have no issues. Also, nice little cup holder on the side.
customer_reviews.author: JRR

customer_reviews.title: Extremely comfy!
customer_reviews.text: This a super comfy chair in which you could easily fall asleep. The chair’s padding and neck pillow make this by far and away the most comfy chair for patio/poolside use. The locking/unlocking mechanisms are easily located, which is good since there was no instruction manual in my shipment. It’s pretty easy to fold/unfold once you discover how to do it (again, no instruction manual in my shipment). Very easy to store away inside because this chair will deteriorate with long-term exposure to the elements.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and super comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is the most comfortable fordable outdoor chair that I have ever sat in.The lightweight aluminum frame is sturdy and easy to set up, and the padded seat with adjustable headrest allows you to kick back in comfort with support for your head or lumbar region. Keep a drink handy using the foldout side table, with holders built in for your cup and phone. You can adjust the chair from upright to a fully reclined position for a midday nap or cloud watching. And when it’s time to pack up, it folds up compactly to easily slip in the car trunk or closet.Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: C2

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth The Price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Such a disappointing purchase these chairs turned out to be! We thought that by spending more money on these chairs, we were getting a quality product! However, this is not a case of "you get what you pay for!" We've had them only a month, and the grommets have rusted and the wooden arm rests have black mold!!! I can't understand how these chairs receive such high marks from many reviewers!?! I wish I had read the one star reviews before purchasing! Buyer beware! These chairs are not at all worth the inflated price!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: dalila

customer_reviews.title: Well made and very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Love the extra width and the fact that I can recline at any angle I want. Now if you can tell me how to keep my teenage sun bathing grandkids off it so I can have a turn. I even bought a second one.
customer_reviews.author: SPR

customer_reviews.title: Like this chair a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the chair for a few weeks now. I am 280 pounds and so far this chair seems to handle my weight with no problem. Seems very welll built with strong seating material (and comfortable), well secured by being tied into the metal support beams. I will update in a couple/few months, but so far, based on what I've experienced sitting in it each night for a couple hours, I have no hesitation giving it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Pesach

customer_reviews.title: Ripped within a week
customer_reviews.text: We bought this chair just over a week ago and brought it camping to use for the first time and a day or two into the trip we noticed it had ripped already...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love to go fishing and camping because I’m an outdoor guy, so this is really helpful. Very convenient as I can bring it almost anywhere since it’s so compact once it’s folded. Very comfortable when I sit in it too, which I didn’t expect because it doesn’t look comfortable at first. Removable head rest and an attachable cup holder so this chair has it all. Overall very nice purchase for me!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: 3 month after purchase I still love itil
customer_reviews.text: I was sitting in this chair reflecting on how much I have enjoyed having this chair and was moved to write a review. The chair is very well constructed and exceedlingly comfortable. The pillow moves up and down while still attached allowing it to sit at the perfect place for each individual. The reclining mechanism works very well. I am almost 230 lbs and the chair is super roomy and sturdy. The drink holder is handy but a little attached tray would have been even better. Definitely recommend to anybody considering this purchase. Now that it has finally stopped raining all the time, I spend more time in this chair than I would care to admit.
customer_reviews.author: Adam U

customer_reviews.title: Great! I have bought cheaper zero-gravity chairs with mixed ...
customer_reviews.text: Great! I have bought cheaper zero-gravity chairs with mixed results. I am 6'3" and 275# and this chair feels like it could handle two of me. Very high quality and rock-solid. It's a little expensive, but much better than the cheaper models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer BoBoTrace

customer_reviews.title: Comfy but heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Super comfy but a beast to transport. So don't get if you have to carry it a long distant. They need to have a way to keep chair from opening when carrying. Had to buy velcour strips. For the price it should be a feature.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Creel

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent, but rusts and weathers quickly and footrest is uncomfortable
customer_reviews.text: The title says most of it. Aside from being a bit of a pain to figure out how to fold and unfold, the chairs are pretty decent. They're certainly comfortable enough to sit and recline it. But if you're not wearing shoes, the metal bar that's the de facto footrest is pretty uncomfortable to rest your feet on. Also, the arms and of the chair and the metal bits (though not the metal footrest) weather and rust pretty quickly. Not sure I'd get these chairs if I could do it all over. But if I did, I'd definitely get covers to protect them when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Thunder Road

product_meta.title: Timber Ridge Zero Gravity Chair Oversized Recliner Padded Folding Patio Lounge Chair 350lbs Capacity Adjustable Lawn Chair with Cup Holder, Headrest, for Outdoor, Camping, Patio, Lawn
feature_bullets: Outstanding Loading Capacity: Anti gravity chair supports up to 350lbs. Sturdy steel tube frame, premium quality elastic cord, and durable polyester fabric make this heavy-duty zero gravity chair is sturdy enough for everyday use

Adjustable Reclining Position: Patented locking mechanism on this outdoor recliner. Easy locking levers adjust and lock the oversized zero gravity chair to any position from upright to fully laid-back. The easiest locking mechanism on the market
Oversized Dimension: 43.5 x 22 x 21.3 inches. The fully reclined length of the reclining camping chair is 72 inches. Our zero gravity chair xl provides you enough space for your outdoor relaxing.

Comfortable Design: Padded folding chair designed with full padded seating, removable pillow for both head and lumbar support. Ergonomic design and natural wood armrest on this outdoor recliner provides a zero-gravity weightless experience

No Assembly: This folding lawn chair can be folded and unfold in seconds. The camping lounge chair is easy transportation and storage. Suitable for patio, lawn, garden, yard or balcony. We back our products with a full 1-year manufacturer's warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,450 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
